addons.name: Imagus
addons.description: With a simple mouse-over you can enlarge images and display images/videos from links.
addons.fullDescription:
There are plenty of settings which can be customized, and reviewing them is currently the best way to learn about what the extension is capable of.

Sections on the options page, and their brief explanation:

▪ Sieve
An expandable set of rules for getting the larger image, media or other content.
It has more than 200 rules by default, which support thousands of sites across the web, including the popular ones such as Reddit/Imgur, Wikipedia (or any WikiMedia based site), deviantART, Google services (Images, YouTube, G+, Picasa...), Facebook, Twitter, Flickr...

▪ Grants
List of user defined rules for blocking/allowing specific sites.

addons.name: KeePassXC-Browser
addons.description: Official browser plugin for the KeePassXC password manager (https://keepassxc.org).
addons.fullDescription:
Official browser plugin for the KeePassXC password manager (https://keepassxc.org).

The thing computers can do best is storing information.
You shouldn't waste your time trying to remember and type your passwords.
KeePassXC can store your passwords safely and auto-type them into your everyday websites and applications.

addons.name: Copy URL To Clipboard
addons.description: Copy document URL / link URL to clipboard as HTML, Markdown, Text etc.
addons.fullDescription:
Copy document URL / link URL to clipboard as HTML, Markdown, BBCode, Textile, AsciiDoc, MediaWiki, Jira, reStructuredText, LaTeX, CSV and Text.

* When copying the URL of the page, right-click anywhere on the page and open the context menu, then select the format to copy.
* When you right-click on a link (an anchor element), you can copy the URL of that link.
* If you select some text before right-click, that selected text will be used for the content of the link.
* You can edit content text when copying.
* Copy to clipboard can be executed from the context menu, the tool button, or keyboard shortcut.

NOTE: Currently, enabled only on (X)HTML documents.
